item.title: Marvel Rivals: Every Season 1 Battle Pass Skin, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Marvel Rivals introduces 10 new skins for Season 1 via the Battle Pass system, offering various customization options.
  • Skins range from simple re-skins to drastic overhauls, providing players with creative and visually appealing designs to enhance gameplay.
  • Each hero featured in the Battle Pass receives unique skin transformations that cater to their character traits and abilities.

In keeping in line with NetEase's promise to provide consistent updates for Marvel Rivals , the developers of the immensely popular hero shooter introduced tons of new skins for Season 1, all of which can be acquired through the Battle Pass. Players will acquire Chrono Tokens upon completing challenges and playing matches, which can then be used to buy an assortment of customizable items from the Battle Pass, including the skins, of which there are 10.

Admittedly, these outfits do vary massively in their overall quality, ranging from basic re-skins to drastic overhauls that completely change the design and aesthetic of the character. From a visual point of view, here is how each of the newest Marvel Rivals skins match up in terms of creativity and overall design.

10 Blue Tarantula - Peni Parker

A Small Re-Skin That Makes Peni A Little More Vibrant

While Blue Tarantula may not be as flashy or interesting as many of the other skins in the Battle Pass, it can also be received without needing to actually buy the Luxury Battle Pass itself, making it essentially a free unlock. The skin itself reverses some of Peni's original colors, turning her red and orange armor into a blue and green suit instead, which looks a little more vibrant.

Peni's own outfit also changes colors to suit the blue color palette of the SP//DR suit, but outside of that, the rest of the design is pretty much the same as normal. Still, it's a nice addition for those Peni players who want some extra customization options for their character, even if they are simply small alterations such as this one.

9 Emporium Matron - Scarlet Witch

The Queen Of Chaos Dresses Up For The Occasion

The biggest difference with the Emporium Matron skin is Scarlet Witch's hair, which turns from red to a pitch black. This creates a captivating contrast when paired with the blood-red and gold dress that the queen of chaos throws on, creating a much more eye-catching design when compared to her original look.

It's clear that the designers at NetEase focused on dark and fiery colors to feed into Scarlet Witch's personality and powers when creating this skin, and while it's not a massive overhaul, it is still jaw-dopping to look at. It's simply a great alternative for the dangerous Duelist.

8 Blood Moon Knight - Moon Knight

Moon Knight Looks Extra Menacing With This Darker Design

Moon Knight's usual bright white cape turns to a moody black with his Blood Moon skin, allowing him to blend into the shadows while picking off his enemies from afar. In keeping with the name, Moon Knight's blades become bright red, with one even showing up on the logo, which can be seen on the back of his cloak.

The Blood Moon Knight skin makes Moon Knight look like a true assassin, and it's a real marvel to look at thanks to the clever use of color coordination and the small details scattered all around the suit, giving the outfit tons of personality.

7 Savage Sub-Mariner - Namor

Namor Gains A Few Extra Additions To His Suit, Along With A New Shiny Trident

Namor's regular outfit receives a serious upgrade with Savage Sub-Mariner, a callback to his change in outfit during the Sub-Mariner comic series in the late 1960s. While Namor keeps his spiky single shoulder pad, he also gains a jacket that is covered with golden spikes and decorations, along with a large crown that represents his dominance over humankind.

Even Namor's trident receives a re-skin, with the edge turning from bronze to a shimmering blue, along with the opposite end changing into the same color. It's a small redesign, but it's one that succeeds in making Namor a lot more visually interesting from a design perspective.

6 Bounty Hunter - Rocket Raccoon

Rocket's Coming To Earn His Pay, And He's Doing It In Style

Rocket receives an entire makeover with his Bounty Hunter skin, with his fur turning into a deep ginger and his eyes becoming bright red. However, that's just the tip of the iceberg in terms of differences, as the furry guardian also receives a bounty hunter attire fitted with a stylish hat, goggles, and a raccoon-sized hunter's jacket.

NetEase really went above and beyond when designing this unique skin, and it's a real joy to look at in-game, serving as an example of how a skin can stand out without needing to go overboard with bright and explosive colors. It also nicely feeds into Rocket's whole obsession with money and treasure, making for a very creative outfit overall.

5 King Magnus - Magneto

Magneto's Intimidating King Magnus Skin Shows Off His Royal Status

Magneto easily upstages his opponents in terms of style when he struts onto the battlefield as King Magnus, the merciless king of Genosha. He puts his royal status on full display with his glistening gold and black royal garments, which are decorated with all kinds of war medals and ornaments. Even the giant ring on Magneto's back, which is used for his ultimate attack, turns a bright gold, allowing him to dominate his enemies in style.

Magneto also looks a lot younger in this skin, but he still retains his signature scowl. King Magnus is a skin that somehow manages to make Magneto look even more intimidating. Needless to say, NetEase knocked it out of the park with this one.

4 Blood Soul - Adam Warlock

Simple But Stylish, Blood Soul Grants Adam Warlock An Epic Yet Mysterious New Outfit

It's not often that healer characters in shooter games will receive skins as epic as this one for Adam Warlock. With a cape covering his shoulders and half of his face, Warlock looks like a mysterious but also dangerous sorcerer with this outfit equipped. He also obtains a belt that is packed full of unique tools, books, and weapons, which are small but welcome additions that help to make the fit look even more detailed.

This is one of those skins that could convince a player to start learning the character just because of how cool it looks, and that's far from a bad thing considering how much fun Adam Warlock's abiltiies are to use in-game.

3 Blood Berserker - Wolverine

Wolverine Takes On The Appearance Of A Vampire Hunter With Blood Berserker Equipped

NetEase has conjured up some incredibly unique and wacky designs for the original skins in Marvel Rivals , but Blood Berserker is a true stand out, seemingly turning Wolverine into a Van Helsing-esque vampire hunter. There's so much to gawk at with this skin, whether it's the fashionable dark hat, long buttoned jacket, or the small silver chain hanging from the mutant's waist. It's genuinely hard to look away due to how effortlessly stylish Wolverine looks.

It's also an interesting change to make his hair long and gray, considering how it is usually seen with the signature spikes, but it works well with the gothic vibe that Wolverine has going on here. As if Wolverine couldn't get any scarier, this skin is guaranteed to invoke fear into the enemy team any time it shows up.

2 Blood Edge Armor - Iron Man

Iron Man Took Some Medieval Inspiration When Creating This Suit

A truly unique design that merges medieval knight armor with a futuristic mech-suit, this skin feels like something out of an Iron Man fan's dreams, and suffice to say, it's a real feast for the eyes. There are tons of small details to look out for with this skin, such as the skulls that appear on both the shoulder and knee pads, feeding into the aesthetic of the design, but it also makes some big changes to Iron Man's basic suit as well. For example, his helmet becomes completely different.

One particular highlight is the bubbling red energy that can be seen shooting out of Tony's visor and chestplate, adding even more vibrancy to Iron Man's latest suit. This season certainly cooked up something special for Iron Man fans, with this being arguably one of the best skins in the entire game thus far.

1 All-Butcher - Loki

Loki's Fusion With The Primordial Symbiote Results In A Terrifying Yet Badass Design

The mischievous trickster Loki already has a pretty eye-catching design with his bright green armor and sinister smirk, but he becomes almost demonic-like with his All-Butcher form, which sees him fuse with the primordial Symbiote. When assuming this form, Loki acquires a skeletal set of armor with bright green energy emanating from the core.

By far the most noticeable aspect of the All-Butcher skin, though, is the Symbiote, which can be seen curling around Loki's body and dripping from the tentacles on his shadows. When paired with the long horns stretching out from his head, it results in an amazing skin that is, thankfully, the very first one that can be unlocked in the battle pass.

item.title: 6 Best Open World Games Where You Face Mythical Beasts
item.description:
Summary

  • Dragon's Dogma 2 offers a complete mythical beast slaying experience.
  • Ark: Survival Evolved has primitive weapons and dragons for epic encounters.
  • Assassin's Creed Odyssey allows you to face fearsome Greek mythological creatures in battle.

The stuff of myth, many players have heard those words and wondered: which open-world games let me fight mythical creatures in a duel to the death? Well, many titles are up to the challenge, but not all of them can offer such a complete experience in the matters of beast slaying.

More so if we keep in mind that most of the games fans play have their own bestiary, born of the imaginary of their creators. But the classic mythical monsters that appear in legends are an entirely different breed: their legends exude respect, fear, and awe. This list spotlights the best open-world games where you face mythical beasts.

7 Dragon's Dogma 2

All The Classic Mythical Creatures Are Here

Griffins, Cyclopses, Drakes, the Dragon, and even a Sphinx, with all and her riddles: Dragon's Dogma 2 is the ultimate mythical beast slaying game, with a splendorous Open-World, and a unique approach to combat that makes players feel completely immersed in these epic battles.

The only downside is that its learning curve is quite crooked, and the difficulty levels (even lowered from the settings) can be a little overwhelming for new players. Still, it is undeniable that combining some of the mechanics from the Monster Hunter series with a classic Western RPG style was a great decision, and had incredible results.

6 Ark: Survival Evolved

Dinosaurs, Dragons, And More

What can be cooler than fighting against dinosaurs using primitive (and not-so-primitive) weapons? Fighting mythical monsters such as dragons, and be able to tame and use them to fight other dinosaurs and dragons.

At that, Ark: Survival Evolved did a great job, though its successor, Survival Ascended still lacks a lot of optimization to make its experience more enjoyable for the fans. The first game, though, still is one of the best games where you face mythical beasts.

5 Assassin's Creed Odyssey

Many Greek Myths Await To Be Hunted Down

From the Erymanthian Boar, to the infamous Nemean Lion, in Assassin's Creed: Odyssey , players can face these mythical beasts in a one-on-one battle, and see who comes out alive.

And since these buffed monsters are quite fearsome, players will often find themselves on the losing side of these epic contests. Though a well-trained Mystios/Assassin can totally overpower these creatures, more so if they're equipped with the best legendary weapons.

4 The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

Harrassed By Dragons, Giants, And Werewolves

Skyrim remains one of the best Open World games in terms of player agency, freedom, and most importantly: non-scripted encounters. A game where a regular stroll through a village can become an epic battle to the death against a Dragon (with an inspiring soundtrack to boot) is hard to come by nowadays.

So, The Elder Scrolls V place remains undisputed among the games that allow you to fight mythical beasts or go on a rampage and murder an entire town while shapeshifted as a werewolf. But players shouldn't worry about the moral implications of such heinous actions, no one is going to judge them (except the Dark Brotherhood maybe).

3 The Witcher 3

Gryphons, Mermaids, Harpies, Leshen, Hags And More

The whole repertoire of the classic European Folklore is available to be fought in The Witcher 3. From the typical Werewolves harassing villagers, to the Royal Gryphons stalking the trade routes, and the sirens drowning poor sailors on the coasts of Skellige.

Its huge open-world setting offers a wide variety of biomes to explore while doing what Geralt does best: Slaying monsters and humans that are quite monstrous as well. If players enjoyed this series, they might be even more happy than ever since soon they will be able to experience the world of The Witcher again in its fourth iteration. This time, Cirilla of Cintra will be the monster hunter in charge.

2 Shadow Of The Colossus

Fight Giant Monsters Using The Power Of Courage

Shadow Of The Colossus is a huge game, and not only because players need to travel across an immense open-world to fight incredible mythical monsters, but also because it has reached a legendary status by itself.

The story of Wander, a young man searching for a way to resurrect his beloved Mono. Though the story itself has been critically acclaimed, its most characteristic feature is its epic battles against the humongous Colossi, creatures that make the earth rumble beneath their feet.

1 God of War: Ragnarok

Kratos Is A Master At Mythical Beast Slaying

The God of War series has always had players facing against mythical beasts in some incredible battles, and Kratos has already slain his fair share of monsters (and Gods) throughout his long career. But it is in GoW: Ragnarok where players will be able to experience the most incredible battles against some of the most notorious monsters of the Norse Mythology.

The battle against Garm is one of the peak moments in the game (tough in the end, it is more about freeing him than slaying him). Overall, the whole title has dozens of such experiences where players can enjoy unleashing Kratos's fury upon countless creatures and other mythological beings.

item.title: Infinity Nikki: Listening to Echoes of the Past Quest Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Start Listening To Echoes Of The Past In Infinity Nikki
  • How To Complete Listening To Echoes Of The Past In Infinity Nikki
    • Where To Find Du Yubai
    • How To Get Pony Curls
    • How To Take A Photo Of Du Yubai
    • Speak To Monaco And Take A Photo
    • Speak To Fournier And Help With The Proposal
    • Find Elettra
    • Watch Du Yubai’s Performance

Listening to Echoes of the Past is a limited-time quest that Infinity Nikki players can find during the Bloom Festival event. The quest will, unfortunately, only be available for around 30 days, and completing it will give Infinity Nikki players a chance to earn various rewards.

Like most quests in the game, Listening to Echoes of the Past requires players to complete Chapter 2 of the main story before unlocking it. Additionally, completing this specific quest will also unlock further events this season. The quest is fairly easy to follow, but there are some instances where you can run into trouble. So, if you find yourself needing a hand, here's a detailed rundown on how to complete the Listening to Echoes of the Past quest in Infinity Nikki .

How To Start Listening To Echoes Of The Past In Infinity Nikki

Triggering the Listening to Echoes of the Past quest is pretty easy; all you need to do is head to the navigation tab and find the quest in your list. Click to track, and the icon will point you towards the White Jade ship in Florawish . Head to the ship and climb aboard to find Hiya. The story will then immediately start, and you’ll find out that the famous artist/musician, Du Yubai, has gone missing. Upon discovering this, Nikki will offer her assistance in locating her.

How To Complete Listening To Echoes Of The Past In Infinity Nikki

Where To Find Du Yubai

Finding Du Yubai is relatively easy, as the map will point out two possible places for her location in Breezy Meadow . You can just teleport to the Bug Catcher’s Cabin Warp Spire and head south on the map to where the icons are pointing. Once you reach the hill, keep to your left, as that’s where you’ll find Du Yubai. She’ll be surrounded by some Esselings, so defeat them and talk to her.

How To Get Pony Curls

This next step can be a little tricky, as it requires players to find some Pony Curls for Du Yubai to use. Pony Curls are typically more difficult to obtain because the ponies are skittish and prone to run away. The navigation will point you to a pony pasture in the vicinity, but as soon as you are at least 100m away , switch to your Animal Grooming Outfit and sneak up on the ponies .

You need to groom Noble Ponies to get Pony Curls . These ones are typically smaller and a darker shade of brown than the usual horses in the pasture.

How To Take A Photo Of Du Yubai

After giving her the pony curls to fix her strings, you’ll have to take a picture of Du Yubai. Use Momo’s Camera at the top left of the screen to do this. The only way you’ll know if it has been done correctly is if you see a gold frame appear around Du Yubai .

If you encounter a bug during this part of the quest and do not see the gold frame , simply log out of Infinity Nikki and log back in to try again.

Speak To Monaco And Take A Photo

After taking the photo with Du Yubai, head to the Mayor’s Office and meet Mayor Grace. After a brief conversation, she’ll direct you to three people, and one of them is Monaco. He’ll be right down the road from the office, so just follow the navigation to find him.

You’ll eventually need to take another photo of him and Du Yubai together, and both the NPCs need to have gold frames surrounding them in order for the picture to register. It also doesn’t matter if Nikki is in the picture or not, so just take the photo, show Monaco, and head to your next target.

Speak To Fournier And Help With The Proposal

Fournier is a chef at Ray and Wing's. You’ll need to head inside the area to interact with him and then offer your help with planning a proposal. There are only two tasks to complete here:

  1. Either find a Sunny Orchid , Rainy Orchid , or Florapom to give Jeka to prepare for the proposal. It doesn’t matter which flower you give her, as the responses are the same. If you don’t have either of these materials in your bag, you can head to Florawish to find Sunny Orchids and Rainy Orchids , whereas Florapoms can be found in Breezy Meadow .
  2. Once you give your chosen flower to Jeka, head back to the counter and interact with the ‘wait’ prompt. A short cutscene will take place, and afterward, you’ll once again have to take a photo and upload it once it has been taken .
  3. You need to make sure that Nikki, Du Yubai, and the other two guests are in the photo . All of their frames will light up, and once the photo has been taken, do not exit the photo screen . Look at the top right of the frame for an upload button .
  4. If you can’t find an upload button at the top of the frame, exit the game, log out, and log back in to retake the photo. The upload button should pop up then.

Find Elettra

Head over to Dream Warehouse Warp Spire and go inside to find the next person, Elettra. You’ll need to rescue her from under a pile of books. From here on out, just follow the navigation and story that will take you to the Dream Warehouse Rooftop, where you, Du Yubai, and Elettra will release some paper cranes.

Watch Du Yubai’s Performance

Now that everything has been completed, head back to the White Jade Ship and go inside to watch Du Yubai’s performance. You may need to change the timing to night to trigger the performance after you sit down .

Watch the final cutscene, speak to Du Yubai, and take another photo with her . You can pose however you want; just make sure that Nikki and Du Yubai are both visible in the photo. Upon doing so, Infinity Nikki players will receive:

  • x50 Diamonds
  • 30K Bling
  • x100 Shiny Bubbles

item.title: EA Sports FC 25: How To Complete Zidane Unleashed TOTY Evolution
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock Zidane Unleashed Evolution In EA Sports FC 25
  • How To Complete 94 OVR TOTY Zidane Unleashed Evolution In EA Sports FC 25
  • Is EA Sports FC 25's Zidane Unleashed Evolution Worth Completing?

It’s a rare occasion when EA Sports offers players a TOTY card for free, let alone one that can be enhanced through an Evolution. In celebration of Zinedine Zidane’s legendary career – most notably his 2002 Champions League victory and trophy lift with Real Madrid – EA Sports FC 25 introduces a TOTY Icon Era version of Zidane with a 90 overall rating.

Moreover, players can elevate the French legend's special card by completing the exclusive Evolution, boosting his overall rating to an impressive 94. This upgrade also provides significant stat enhancements, making Zidane a standout addition to any Ultimate Team lineup. Here’s a rundown on how to complete the TOTY Icon Zidane Unleashed Evolution in EA FC 25 .

How To Unlock Zidane Unleashed Evolution In EA Sports FC 25

To unlock the Club Members Zidane Unleashed Evolution in EA FC 25 , you must be an FC 25 Club Member , which requires you to have played EA Sports FC 24 by September 26, 2024, and EA Sports FC 25 by October 31, 2024 . This will grant you the exclusive Evolution upgrade you'll find within the Evolutions menu in your Club section.

How To Complete 94 OVR TOTY Zidane Unleashed Evolution In EA Sports FC 25

To complete the Zidane Unleashed Evolution, which upgrades Zinedine Zidane to a 94 overall rating in EA Sports FC 25 , players must progress through four levels of challenges within Ultimate Team before March 13, 2025 . Each level requires the completion of specific objectives across various Ultimate Team modes:

Card

Level

Challenges

Upgrade Rewards

Level 1

Win two matches in Rush, Rivals, Champions, or Squad Battles on min. Semi-Pro using your active EVO player in-game.

Play three matches in Rush, Rivals, Champions, or Squad Battles on min. Semi-Pro using your active EVO player in-game.

Overall +1

Shooting +2

Passing +2

Playmaker++ Role

Level 2

Win two matches in Rivals, Rush, Champions, or Squad Battles on min. Semi-Pro using your active EVO player in game.

Play three matches in Rush, Rivals, Champions, or Squad Battles on min. Semi-Pro using your active EVO player in-game.

Overall +1

Shooting +2

Dribbling +2

Half Winger++ Role

Technical PlayStyle

Level 3

Win two matches in Rush, Rivals, Champions, or Squad Battles on min. Semi-Pro using your active EVO player in-game.

Play three matches in Rush, Rivals, Champions, or Squad Battles on min. Semi-Pro using your active EVO player in-game.

Overall +1

Shooting +2

Physical +4

Shadow Striker++ Role

Long Ball Pass PlayStyle

Level 4

Win two matches in Rush, Rivals, Champions, or Squad Battles on min. Semi-Pro using your active EVO player in-game.

Play three matches in Rush, Rivals, Champions, or Squad Battles on min. Semi-Pro using your active EVO player in-game.

Overall +1

Shooting +2

Defending +4

Classic 10++ Role

Pinged Pass PlayStyle+

To claim the base 90-rated Zidane card in EA Sports FC 25 , you must have played the game between January 17, 2025, and February 14, 2025. If you meet this requirement, the card can be redeemed through the in-game store when you log into the game. Completing all four Evolution levels not only grants the upgraded version of Zidane but also enhances his stats significantly, making him a pivotal addition to any lineup.

Is EA Sports FC 25's Zidane Unleashed Evolution Worth Completing?

The Zidane Unleashed Evolution in EA Sports FC 25 is an excellent opportunity to enhance your squad with a 94-rated TOTY Icon. Given the straightforward requirements, completing this Evolution is highly rewarding. If you have this Evo upgrade available, you've probably invested considerable time or resources into the game, which makes this a great chance to add a legendary midfielder who can dominate in multiple areas.

Zidane’s upgraded card excels in both attack and defense. His Pinged Pass PlayStyle+ allows for precise long passes to attackers, facilitating swift counterattacks. Additionally, his mobility and agility make him a dynamic force in offensive transitions. On the defensive end, he can fulfill midfield responsibilities effectively, even without being a traditional CDM, providing versatility that elevates any Ultimate Team lineup.

To complete the Evolution quickly, focus on Squad Battles. The main challenge involves playing 12 matches and securing three wins in each rival update, streamlining progress toward completing the upgrade.

item.title: Infinity Nikki: All Expedition Handbook Spots (Wishfield Chapter)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Complete the Expedition Handbook in Infinity Nikki
  • All Expedition Handbook Spots in Infinity Nikki (Locations)
    • Expedition Stamp 1 - Old Florawish Memorial
    • Expedition Stamp 2 - Memorial Mountains Log Bridge
    • Expedition Stamp 3 - Swing by the Path
    • Expedition Stamp 4 - Lilina's Statue
    • Expedition Stamp 5 - Ray and Wing's
    • Expedition Stamp 6 - Ancient Tree Swing
    • Expedition Stamp 7 - Lakeside Picnic Area
    • Expedition Stamp 8 - Wharf Bench
    • Expedition Stamp 9 - Street Corner Graffiti
    • Expedition Stamp 10 - Ruins Plaza Corner
    • Expedition Stamp 11 - Emerald Pond
    • Expedition Stamp 12 - Quiet Cenote
    • Expedition Stamp 13 - Nonoy's Dressing Mirror
    • Expedition Stamp 14 - Sanctum of the Observant
    • Expedition Stamp 15 - Ray and Wing's Dessert Bar
    • Expedition Stamp 16 - Bibcoon's Chuckle Club Stage
    • Expedition Stamp 17 - Nonoy's Bedroom
    • Expedition Stamp 18 - Bug Catcher's Cabin
    • Expedition Stamp 19 - Blossom Forest
    • Expedition Stamp 20 - Swan Gazebo
    • Expedition Stamp 21 - Bullquet Habitat
    • Expedition Stamp 22 - Queen's Palace Ruins
    • Expedition Stamp 23 - Queen's Palace Ruins Tower
    • Expedition Stamp 24 - Art Academy Field Base
    • Expedition Stamp 25 - Abandoned Fanatic Wisher Camp
    • Expedition Stamp 26 - Shimmer Pond
    • Expedition Stamp 27 - Lakeheart Stonetree
    • Expedition Stamp 28 - Flower Fields Viewpoint
    • Expedition Stamp 29 - Village Residence
    • Expedition Stamp 30 - Lavenfringe Fields
    • Expedition Stamp 31 - Village Corner
    • Expedition Stamp 32 - Golden Fields
    • Expedition Stamp 33 - Handsome Lads Circus
    • Expedition Stamp 34 - Market of Mirth
    • Expedition Stamp 35 - Choo-Choo Station
    • Expedition Stamp 36 - Valley Entrance
    • Expedition Stamp 37 - Wishcraft Lab Entrance
    • Expedition Stamp 38 - Tranquil Shoal
    • Expedition Stamp 39 - Grand Millewish Tree
    • Expedition Stamp 40 - Timis's Beauty Lab
  • How to Complete Expeditions: Wishfield in Infinity Nikki

While fashion is always at the forefront of many players' agendas in Infinity Nikki , there are many other kinds of activities and challenges to embark on in Wishfield as well. Whether it's playing an assortment of mini-games, solving quests and other mysteries, or simply snapping photos of Miraland's many landmarks, there's never a shortage of adventures that, keeping the game's devoted player community plenty busy since its fantastically successful launch in December 2024.

One particular type of challenge in Infinity Nikki that's easy to overlook is your Expedition Handbook. If you feel compelled to embark on this adventure to fill its pages with dozens of memorable pictures, you'll need to know where to find them all.

How to Complete the Expedition Handbook in Infinity Nikki

The Expedition Handbook in Infinity Nikki essentially acts as a cozy scrapbook for Nikki and Momo's adventures in Wishfield, requiring you to take memorable photos at specific locations in each region of the game. Some are as simple as a photo on a scenic bench, while others require you to capture an entire structure in the shot. You can include Nikki in the photos if you wish, and it can be a prime opportunity to get some fashionable shots for yourself as well.

To ensure that you capture a photo that qualifies for the Handbook, open Photo Mode in the correct spot and adjust the angle of your lens until a box appears over an area with a caption indicating the required photographic subject. When it does, snap your picture and hit 'Upload' to apply it to your Handbook. Once done, you'll be rewarded with 3x Upgrade Packs .

All Expedition Handbook Spots in Infinity Nikki (Locations)

Below is a comprehensive list of all 40 Expedition Handbook spots in the Wishfield Chapter of Infinity Nikki , including their exact locations and how to capture the desired shot itself via Photo Mode. For ease of reference, they're listed in the same order present within the Handbook.

Expedition Stamp 1 - Old Florawish Memorial

To capture this shot, go to the Old Florawish Memorial, where Kilo the Cadenceborn is located (use the 'Beside the Statue in the Old Florawish Memorial' Warp Spire to get there). Go across the broken bridge towards the headless statue, jump over the gap, and stop at the edge on the other side of said gap. Open Photo Mode and make sure to get the stairs leading up to the statue in the shot, along with the statue itself.

Expedition Stamp 2 - Memorial Mountains Log Bridge

To get this Expedition shot, head south on foot along the path directly from the Old Florawish Memorial. Keep going until you see a log bridge hanging over the path with Blings lining the way across (if you haven't collected them for the day already). Stand directly beneath the log bridge and open Photo Mode. Adjust the angle until the bridge is highlighted and take your shot.

Expedition Stamp 3 - Swing by the Path

To find and capture this shot, follow the path into Florawish from the Warp Spire at the entrance bridge. Look for Elena's flower shop on the left side of the path, and there will be a wooden swing next to the shop. Have Nikki sit on the swing and open Photo Mode to take a picture.

Expedition Stamp 4 - Lilina's Statue

This Expedition shot can be found by teleporting to the Mayor's Residence in Florawish via the respective Warp Spire. Then, follow the path opposite the entrance until you see a statue at the fork. You may have encountered this statue during a previous quest. Either way, it depicts Lilina, the first mayor of Florawish. Stand near the statue and open Photo Mode to take your shot once it's highlighted.

Expedition Stamp 5 - Ray and Wing's

This Expedition shot is also found in Florawish , specifically at Ray and Wing's restaurant . To get there, you can teleport to the Mayor's Residence Warp Spire and follow the path away from it until you arrive at the plaza where Ray and Wing's restaurant is. Otherwise, you can follow the path from the Stylists' Guild and across the bridge until you approach the building from the left. Stand in front of the restaurant and open Photo Mode to get your shot.

Expedition Stamp 6 - Ancient Tree Swing

The Ancient Tree Swing Expedition shot can be found behind one of the houses near the Stylists Guild in Florawish . To get there, simply teleport to the Stylists' Guild Warp Spire . Then, head towards the Great Wish Tree. Hang a right from that plaza and follow the path between two buildings until you see the tree with the swing a short distance ahead and on the right. Have Nikki sit in the swing and open Photo Mode to get your shot for the Handbook.

Expedition Stamp 7 - Lakeside Picnic Area

This is another Expedition shot found in Florawish, and the easiest way to get to it is by starting from the Mayor's Residence. Teleport to the Warp Spire there if need be. Then, head directly south from the residence towards the lakeside until you see what look like some picnic spots on the grass. The one that's unoccupied is your Expedition spot; have Nikki take a seat on it and open up Photo Mode for a nice waterfront photo.

Expedition Stamp 8 - Wharf Bench

The Wharf Bench Expedition shot is located directly behind the wharf building in Florawish , at the bench underneath an awning decorated with ornaments. The easiest way to get there is by teleporting to the Mayor's Residence via the respective War Spire and running directly south from there. Have Nikki sit on the bench and open Photo Mode to prepare your shot. Once the bench is highlighted, snap your photo.

Expedition Stamp 9 - Street Corner Graffiti

This Expedition shot is found down the stairs across from the Great Wish Tree plaza in Florawish . Hang a right from the plaza in between Timido's bug shop and Laurent's restaurant. At the bottom of the stairs you should see a woman working on the graffiti (if it's daytime), which consists of paper cranes flying among clouds. Stand next to the graffiti decor and enter Photo Mode to take your shot.

Expedition Stamp 10 - Ruins Plaza Corner

This Expedition shot is found in the ruins in the northern area of Florawish . If you have the Warp Spires unlocked, use the Dream Warehouse Tower Warp Spire to teleport nearby and then float down into the plaza area below the warehouse.

Approach the circular building on the side of the plaza closest to Florawish proper and stand at the bottom of the stairs leading up to it. Open Photo Mode and angle the shot to where it shows most of the building structure, until it's highlighted. A Faewish Sprite may pop up in the corner, but this won't impact your photo's quality.

Expedition Stamp 11 - Emerald Pond

To reach this Expedition shot, you'll need to enter Warehouse Cavern , and its entrance can be found directly east of the Dream Warehouse, on the side of a cliff. Follow the main path through the cavern until you get the ping on your HUD for Emerald Pond. There should be a log next to the pond where you can have Nikki sit for the shot.

Expedition Stamp 12 - Quiet Cenote

This Expedition shot is found inside the Riverside Cavern , which is located near the Old Florawish Memorial . Find the entrance by leaving the Old Florawish Memorial and hugging the barrier to the left. Go around a cliff outcrop, and it will be directly ahead on the left. Head inside and follow the path until you reach a waterfall area. Open Photo Mode here and make sure to include the waterfull in the shot to get credit.

Expedition Stamp 13 - Nonoy's Dressing Mirror

This Expedition shot is found inside of Nonoy's home in Florawish. To get there, you can teleport to the Stylists' Guild and then head past the Great Wish Tree plaza. Then, go north up the path to Nonoy's home. Her bedroom is on the second floor, and you'll want to set up the shot in front of her dressing mirror.

Expedition Stamp 14 - Sanctum of the Observant

To get this Expedition shot, you'll need to head to the Sanctum of the Observant , which is found on the far east side of Florawish, near the outskirts. Depending on how thoroughly you've explored this area, (and if you have it unlocked), you can teleport straight there via the 'In Front of the Sanctum of the Observant' Warp Spire or the next closest Warp Spire on Stitch Street . Otherwise, you'll want to hoof it along the path that takes you east along the lakeshore until you reach the church building.

Once there, head inside and set up a shot with the shrine display visible in the back.

Expedition Stamp 15 - Ray and Wing's Dessert Bar

For this Expedition shot, you'll want to head back to Ray and Wing's restaurant in Florawish . This time, go inside and walk over to the dessert bar where Chef Fournier is standing behind the counter. Line up a shot of him behind the bar and feel free to pose Nikki next to it.

Expedition Stamp 16 - Bibcoon's Chuckle Club Stage

This Expedition shot can be found inside Bibcoon's Chuckle Club in Florawish, which you can find the entrance of around the corner on the right side of the Great Wish Tree plaza. It's literally covered in Bibcoon statues, and there's a living one wandering outside, so it's pretty hard to miss.

Head inside and down the stairs until you find the stage on the far side of the club. Then, go into Photo Mode with Nikki posed in front of the stage for a perfect shot.

Expedition Stamp 17 - Nonoy's Bedroom

This Expedition shot is actually right back in the same spot in Nonoy's home in Florawish, and you can capture it at the same time as the photo of her dressing mirror. Head back inside her house north of the Stylists' Guild and head up to her bedroom for a panoramic shot.

Expedition Stamp 18 - Bug Catcher's Cabin

This is the first of several Expedition shots in Breezy Meadow, and for this particular one, you'll want to head to the Bug Catcher's Cabin first. Use the 'Bug Catcher's Cabin' Warp Spire to get there easily (if you have it). Then, head a bit of a ways down the path from the cabin. This shot can be a little tricky to line up; it's recommended that players stand next to the big rock on the left side of the path and then angle the shot in Photo Mode until the cabin is highlighted.

Expedition Stamp 19 - Blossom Forest

For this Expedition shot, you'll want to head to the Cicia Art Academy Field Base in Breezy Meadow, which is surrounded by lush pink trees. Use the Warp Spire of the same name to get there easily (if you have it). Then, follow the path down from the base until you reach the curve.

This shot can be tricky to set up as well. So, go far enough around the curve of the path until you get the 'Blossom Forest' notification on your HUD. The angle needs to be faced out and downward along the path, as seen above. Adjust it until the Blossom Forest is highlighted in a large box.

Expedition Stamp 20 - Swan Gazebo

To get to this Expedition spot, teleport to the Bug Catcher's Cabin and head straight east, following the path through the trees until you reach the ornately decorated Swan Gazebo . Find a spot in front of the gazebo itself and go into Photo Mode. You'll need to pan the camera out until you can get the entire gazebo structure in the shot, at which point, it should be highlighted and ready to go.

Also, you can feel free to go and use your Bye Bye Dust ability outfit to groom the Tuxtail and Rosecrown Swans roosting on the other side of the gazebo while you're there.

Expedition Stamp 21 - Bullquet Habitat

This Expedition shot is found at the one and only spawn location of the Bullquet animal. It's down in the far south area of Breezy Meadow, near the border and east of the Fanatic Wisher Camp. If you have the Warp Spire unlocked, you can teleport to the Abandoned Fanatic Wisher Camp post and go east from there until you reach the flower-filled habitat.

Feel free to get your daily Bullquet Felt as well as some Bustleflies while you're there. Even better, it can help you get the majestic creature into your Expedition shot.

Expedition Stamp 22 - Queen's Palace Ruins

To get to this Expedition shot, you'll need to head to the far south area of Breezy Meadow, where the Queen's Palace is found. If you have the Warp Spires unlocked already, you can teleport to the 'Queen's Palace Ruins Front Yard' one to make the trip much easier. Either way, make your way through the ruins until you reach a big overgrown courtyard with a stone statue of a violin in the center. Pose Nikki with the statue in view until it's highlighted on your Photo Mode HUD. Then, snap your picture.

Expedition Stamp 23 - Queen's Palace Ruins Tower

You can get this next Expedition shot while at the Queen's Palace as well, as it's located at the top of the tower with the destroyed facade. If you already have the Warp Spire unlocked, you can automatically teleport up via the 'Queen's Palace Ruins High Tower.' Make your way up the stairs until you reach the top floor, pose Nikki near the exposed facade, and take the shot once the box appears.

Expedition Stamp 24 - Art Academy Field Base

This Expedition shot is found in central Breezy Meadow at the Cicia Art Academy Field Base . Use the respective Warp Spire to teleport there and head to the back side of the base, where you'll find some locals picnicking on the grass and an outdoor stage area. Have Nikki pose near the stage itself and use Photo Mode to get a straight shot of it.

Expedition Stamp 25 - Abandoned Fanatic Wisher Camp

This next Expedition shot is a bit trickier to find. Not only do you need to travel to the Abandoned Fanatic Wisher Camp on the far southwest side of Breezy Meadow, but you'll also need to find your way into the Campsite Cavern in that area. Make your way to the camp southwest from Lakeside Hill or teleport there via the Abandoned Fanatic Wisher Camp Warp Spire . The entrance to the Campsite Cavern is on the right side of the river and on top of a cliff.

Go inside by dropping down the hole on top of the cliff and follow the main path into a large cavern area. Drop down to the lower part of the area near the crystal blue water and look for a rocky path lined with Blings. This is the setup point for your Expedition shot.

Expedition Stamp 26 - Shimmer Pond

This Expedition shot is situated at Shimmer Pond , the very spot where you engage in a Style Duel with the Sovereign of Elegance herself in Breezy Meadow. Teleport to the Relic Hill Warp Spire and head east until you find the pond.

Depending on your status with the Sovereign of Elegance (if you've defeated her in every challenge), you can do this shot any time of day. However, if her challenge remains active, you should take this Expedition shot during the day when she's not present. Otherwise, upon approaching the area, she'll immediately trigger the challenge.

Expedition Stamp 27 - Lakeheart Stonetree

This is the first of a few Expedition shot locations in Stoneville , and you can find it near the entrance to the region. Follow the main path towards town from the 'Stoneville Entrance' Warp Spire until you see the Lakeheart Stonetree in the middle of the lake. Go to the cliff lookout, where two children are sitting to position your shot, as this one doesn't have a lot of flexibility. You may need to zoom in until the stonetree is highlighted.

Expedition Stamp 28 - Flower Fields Viewpoint

You'll need to do some climbing to get to this Expedition shot in Stoneville . Straight from the previous shot (Lakeheart Stonetree), take the bridge across the river on the path ahead. Then, immediately hang left towards the waterfall. You need to climb it until you reach a stonetree platform at the very top on the right, which has a clear view of the flower fields across the town. Set up your shot so that they're in clear view ahead.

Expedition Stamp 29 - Village Residence

For this Expedition shot, head towards the center of Stoneville until you reach the main bridge with the Village Fork Warp Spire nearby. Stand in the middle of the bridge and open Photo Mode while facing towards the right side of the town, where the houses are in the background. Adjust your angle until the Village Residence is highlighted.

Expedition Stamp 30 - Lavenfringe Fields

This Expedition shot is actually just a few feet away from the previous one in Stoneville . You simply need to cross the bridge to the right side and hop up to the nearby stonetree that overlooks the Lavenfringe Fields ahead. Open Photo Mode here and position a scenic shot towards the fields.

Expedition Stamp 31 - Village Corner

This last Expedition shot in Stoneville is found at the northwest corner of the Lavenfringe Fields, at the steps of a residence with a couple sitting on the porch. It's also close to where you'll find Rico with the Forced Perspective: Flying Buntings quest if you haven't done it already. Position the shot at the foot of the stairs leading up to the house.

Expedition Stamp 32 - Golden Fields

This is the first of a few Expedition shots in the Abandoned District , and you'll find this particular one on the very first island of the region called Golden Fields . From the 'Beside the Golden Fields' Warp Spire , head west until you find a small stone to hop onto by a nearby farm. Turn around and look for the giant windmill on the bigger stonetree nearby, as this will be your focal point for the shot. Open Photo Mode and adjust the angle until the windmill is in the frame.

Expedition Stamp 33 - Handsome Lads Circus

This Expedition shot is found further in the Abandoned District on the Market of Mirth Island. You may still need to do the required main story questline to reach this area, but if you already have, you can use the Handsome Lads Circus Warp Spire to teleport to the top of the island where the circus is. Go over to the display in the center of the area and pose Nikki in front of it for your shot. Then, adjust your focus further out until the structure is highlighted.

Expedition Stamp 34 - Market of Mirth

This Expedition shot in the Abandoned District is arguably one of the trickiest to get to out of the whole bunch, as you need to have full access to the Market of Mirth and all Warp Spires unlocked (preferably). The easiest way to reach this one is by teleporting to the Market of Mirth Summit Path Warp Spire and going southeast across the bridge to the nearby island outcrop, where a bunch of Pieceys are performing on a stage. This stage is the subject of your Expedition shot, so pose Nikki in front and open Photo Mode to get your picture.

Expedition Stamp 35 - Choo-Choo Station

The last Expedition shot in the Abandoned District is found on the Choo-Choo Station island . If you have enough Warp Spires unlocked there, you can simply teleport to 'Choo-Choo Station Shipping Center.' From there, go down to the train platform and set up a shot facing the tracks, where you can see the train and some Pieceys waiting to ride.

Expedition Stamp 36 - Valley Entrance

This is the first of a few Expedition Shots located in the Wishing Woods , which you can reach starting in Chapter 6 of the main story questline. To find this one, you simply need to go to the entrance of the Wishing Woods, right by the Elderwood Riverbank Warp Spire. Stand in the shallow area of the river to the left of the Warp Spire and open Photo Mode. Then, adjust the angle until you have the stone structure on the riverbank in view and highlighted.

Expedition Stamp 37 - Wishcraft Lab Entrance

This Expedition shot is found further in at the entrance to the Wishcraft Lab in the Wishing Woods . Go north of the Wish Inspection Center and/or teleport to the 'Wishcraft Lab' Warp Spire . Run south of the Warp Spire along the smaller path (as seen on the map) until it merges with the bigger path. Right around there should be the location of the shot, and you'll want to face the Wishcraft Lab itself. Open Photo Mode and adjust the angle until the lab is highlighted on the screen.

Expedition Stamp 38 - Tranquil Shoal

This Expedition shot is a bit more vague in its location in the Wishing Woods , but you'll want to start by making your way to the northwest side of the Grand Tree Valley . Teleport to the Grand Tree Shoal Warp Spire if you have it unlocked, and run towards the base of the tree on that side until you get the photo notification for 'Tranquil Shoal.' (Make sure that you're facing the Grand Tree with the mountain range behind you.) Open Photo Mode and adjust the angle upward until 'Tranquil Shoal' is highlighted in the background.

Expedition Stamp 39 - Grand Millewish Tree

This Expedition shot in the Wishing Woods is not far from the previous one - just a bit further west. For extra convenience, you can teleport to the Shoal Slope War Spire if you have it unlocked. Once over there, find a good vantage point north of the Warp Spire and watch for the 'Grand Millewish Tree' photo notification. Face the camera with the Grand Millewish Tree in the background and take your photo once the angle is set.

Expedition Stamp 40 - Timis's Beauty Lab

The final Expedition shot of the series is right outside the entrance to Timis's Beauty Lab in the Wishing Woods. Teleport to the respective Warp Spire there, cross the bridge, and follow the path away from her lab. Keep on the path until you get the photo notification ping for 'Timis's Beauty Lab'. Then, turn to face the camera in Photo Mode while having the lab in the background. If required, adjust the angle until the lab is highlighted in the shot.

How to Complete Expeditions: Wishfield in Infinity Nikki

Once you've successfully filled every stamp in your Expedition Handbook, the Expeditions: Wishfield random quest will automatically unlock, serving as the finale for the challenge. The objective here is to "go to the location in the photo," so hit 'Track' on the quest itself, and the location will be revealed on your map.

Your destination can be found on the path connecting Florawish and the Old Florawish Memorial , where Kilo the Cadenceborn is. You can either teleport to the 'Beside the Statue in the Old Florawish Memorial' Warp Spire or the 'Florawish Lane' one and hoof it from there.

Look for a stone gazebo structure next to the path, and standing inside it will be Visuno . Speak to her, and she'll reveal herself to be the Expedition Ambassador of Wishfield. After congratulating Nikki on her incredible efforts to fill the entire Wishfield chapter of the Handbook, she'll request that you to take a photo inside the gazebo.

Open Photo Mode, and the structure will be revealed as the 'Star Pavilion.' Take your desired photo, 'Upload' it to the Handbook just like before, and it will be added on the last page.

You'll also receive the following rewards:

  • 20x Diamonds
  • 'Expedition Souvenir' sketch (top)
